itemListElement.name: Farfalle with Swiss Chard Pesto. vegan

@graph.name: Farfalle with Swiss Chard Pesto
@graph.description: a quick and easy weeknight meal that can be prepared ahead of time. A vegan recipe that can be made gluten free
recipeIngredient: 1.5-2 cups farfalle (cooked al-dente with salt (or any pasta of choice. Use gf pasta for gf))
5  big Swiss chard leaves and soft ribs
1 teaspoon olive oil or organic canola oil
1/2 teaspoon chili flakes or black pepper
1/2 cup packed basil (or use 2 Tablespoons basil pesto)
1/4 cup water (coz my blender needs some water to blend well. and hence made about 1 cup of pesto)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil/canola in a pan on low-medium heat, add garlic and chopped Swiss chard. Cook covered on low for 4-6 minutes or until the chard just about starts to wilt.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat olive oil/canola in a pan on low-medium heat, add garlic and chopped Swiss chard. Cook covered on low for 4-6 minutes or until the chard just about starts to wilt.

recipeInstructions.text: Blend with basil, pepper, Extra virgin olive oil cashews and a little water if needed. The pesto can be stored in the refrigerator for 3-4 days, without any change in color.
recipeInstructions.name: Blend with basil, pepper, Extra virgin olive oil cashews and a little water if needed. The pesto can be stored in the refrigerator for 3-4 days, without any change in color.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook pasta, and serve topped with the pesto.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook pasta, and serve topped with the pesto.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with some powdered Raw cashew mixed with nutritional yeast and pepper flakes.
recipeInstructions.name: Garnish with some powdered Raw cashew mixed with nutritional yeast and pepper flakes.

@graph.keywords: green pesto, pasta main course, vegan pasta dish
